DataElement.preferredName: Malignant Lymphoma First Cancer Progression Other Extranodal Site Text
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Name of the extranodal anatomic location of the first progression of malignant lymphoma different from those already specified or mentioned.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Malignant Lymphoma First Cancer Progression Other Anatomic Site
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: (ma-LIG-nant) Cancerous; a growth with a tendency to invade and destroy nearby tissue and spread to other parts of the body._A malignant (clonal) proliferation of B- lymphocytes or T- lymphocytes which involves the lymph nodes, bone marrow and/or extranodal sites. This category includes Non-Hodgkin lymphomas and Hodgkin lymphomas._Preceding all others in time or space or degree._A pathologic process in which alterations at the molecular level result in a more aggressive cytologic and phenotypic profile and clinical course of a malignant neoplasm._Different than the one(s) previously specified or mentioned._Named locations of, or within, the body.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: (ma-LIG-nant) Cancerous; a growth with a tendency to invade and destroy nearby tissue and spread to other parts of the body.:A malignant (clonal) proliferation of B- lymphocytes or T- lymphocytes which involves the lymph nodes, bone marrow and/or extranodal sites. This category includes Non-Hodgkin lymphomas and Hodgkin lymphomas.

Concepts.definition: Refers to abnormal cell activity manifested by decreased control over growth and function, causing tumor growth or spread into surrounding tissue and adverse effects to the host.

A malignant (clonal) proliferation of B- lymphocytes or T- lymphocytes which involves the lymph nodes, bone marrow and/or extranodal sites. This category includes Non-Hodgkin lymphomas and Hodgkin lymphomas.

Property.preferredName: First Cancer Progression Other Anatomic Site
Property.preferredDefinition: Preceding all others in time or space or degree.:The worsening of a cancer over time.:Different than the one(s) previously specified or mentioned.:Named locations of, or within, the body.

Concepts.definition: Preceding all others in time or space or degree.
A pathologic process in which alterations at the molecular level result in a more aggressive cytologic and phenotypic profile and clinical course of a malignant neoplasm.
Different than the one(s) previously specified or mentioned.
Named locations of or within the body.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the results or effects (does not include CTC Adverse Events) of therapeutic agents or procedures administered to the patient.

DataElementConcept.changeDescription: Released per approval by B. McClure-Shimel. mc 10/4/11

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: (MET-uh-STAT-ik) Having to do with metastasis, which is the spread of cancer from one part of the body to another._Named locations of, or within, the body._Text; the words of something written.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: locations or structures in the human body.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: (MET-uh-STAT-ik) Having to do with metastasis, which is the spread of cancer from one part of the body to another.:Named locations of, or within, the body.:Text; the words of something written.

Concepts.definition: A term referring to the clinical or pathologic observation of a tumor extension from its original site of growth to another anatomic site.
Named locations of or within the body.
